result.execSummary:
The defendant Yeftakyah Curtis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Yeftakyah Curtis is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Yeftakyah Curtis was found guilty of Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.  To be collected by the Department of Corrections.

$268.00 to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervison or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.  $250 DNA surcharge remitted.
Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with RB or GM without written consent of agent.

Completion of aggression/anger management treatment.  Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Reporter: Melanie Nelson
Ct performs Ludwig hearing w/defn.  Defn takes time to review the offer.  Defn rejects offer - leave on
Status conference on January 5, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
Per Rotation Order, incoming branch 2 judge, Josann Reynolds, shall be assigned all open cases previously assigned to former branch 2 judge, Maryann Sumi.
Jury selection on January 12, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Reporter: Melanie Nelson
Atty Van Rybroek states that she and her client are at an impasse.  Defn is questioning the WI judicial system.  State makes their last and best offer and Ct performs Ludwig hearing.  Defn had now decided to take the offer.  Defn again refuses to enter pleas and wants to take to trial.  Defn does not want Atty Van Rybroek to represent him.  Atty Van Rybroek would like to withdraw.  Mr Curtis addresses the Ct and would like new counsel.  He is unsatisfied with the negotiations that have been made between state and defn counsel.  State objects to set-over.  Ct grants request for Atty Van Rybroek to withdraw and will set new trial dates.  Atty Van Rybroek will not be replaced on the CM case.
If sate has issues w/scheduling witnesses in the future, defn cannot object to any possible requests for s/o by the state.  There will be NO further requests granted for s/o by the defn.  No further status conf's will be re rescheduled.
